comments.message: Hi Jennifer, interesting post! Any chance you could find an image to go along with it? Images help grab attention and tell a story with higher impact. You should be able to use the Update Entry button on the right of your post and follow the instructions to add images from there. We know occasionally people have issues uploading images so let us know by hitting the Feedback button at the bottom of most pages of our site if you face any problems. Looking forward to seeing more of your inspiring insights on OpenIDEO. summary: Ok guys I need help identifying a substance that would work for this idea.   I have this vision in my head of spraying something akin to foam insulation on the suit prior to removal allowing it to harden creating a clean non infected protective layer that can be handled much more safely.   I do believe foam insulation is toxic and so is probably not feasible.   But do any of you have ideas of what would work.   For example scotch guard, or maybe even several layers of spray paint.   It would be best if it were colored so you could visually identify that all areas have been covered.   Any input is much appreciated!
title: Spraying a protective hardening layer over the ppe suit trapping any virus particles underneath it prior to removing it making chance of infection while removing suit greatly reduced.
